work in South Carolina. I think it's a poignant

1320.15.text:
kind of instantiation of the politics around
identity that's happening after genetic ancestry

1325.08.text:
testing. So I don't have a pointer here, but
the three people whose hands are meeting in

1328.90.text:
the middle, there is Isaiah Washington, who
was at a -- it was a ceremony that was meant

1335.20.text:
to commemorate people who -- Carolina lowlands
people who had come from the African continent

1343.32.text:
and who had lost their lives, either on the
journey, or who had become -- who were enslaved

1348.04.text:
in the Carolinas. And this is on the banks
of the Ashley River, so Isaiah Washington

1352.62.text:
is here representing a category of people
he calls DNA Sierra Leonians. The woman in

1366.63.text:
to Sierra Leone, right, that's that actual
